summary.long: Mark is a book of the New Testament.

verses.text: The beginning of the good news about Jesus the Messiah, the Son of God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
as it is written in Isaiah the prophet:
“I will send my messenger ahead of you,
    who will prepare your way”—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“a voice of one calling in the wilderness,
‘Prepare the way for the Lord,
    make straight paths for him.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And so John the Baptist appeared in the wilderness, preaching a baptism of repentance for the forgiveness of sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The whole Judean countryside and all the people of Jerusalem went out to him. Confessing their sins, they were baptized by him in the Jordan River.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: John wore clothing made of camel’s hair, with a leather belt around his waist, and he ate locusts and wild honey.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And this was his message: “After me comes the one more powerful than I, the straps of whose sandals I am not worthy to stoop down and untie.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I baptize you with water, but he will baptize you with the Holy Spirit.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time Jesus came from Nazareth in Galilee and was baptized by John in the Jordan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Just as Jesus was coming up out of the water, he saw heaven being torn open and the Spirit descending on him like a dove.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And a voice came from heaven: “You are my Son, whom I love; with you I am well pleased.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At once the Spirit sent him out into the wilderness,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he was in the wilderness forty days, being tempted by Satan. He was with the wild animals, and angels attended him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After John was put in prison, Jesus went into Galilee, proclaiming the good news of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The time has come,” he said. “The kingdom of God has come near. Repent and believe the good news!”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: As Jesus walked beside the Sea of Galilee, he saw Simon and his brother Andrew casting a net into the lake, for they were fishermen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Come, follow me,” Jesus said, “and I will send you out to fish for people.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: At once they left their nets and followed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he had gone a little farther, he saw James son of Zebedee and his brother John in a boat, preparing their nets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Without delay he called them, and they left their father Zebedee in the boat with the hired men and followed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They went to Capernaum, and when the Sabbath came, Jesus went into the synagogue and began to teach.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people were amazed at his teaching, because he taught them as one who had authority, not as the teachers of the law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Just then a man in their synagogue who was possessed by an impure spirit cried out,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “What do you want with us, Jesus of Nazareth? Have you come to destroy us? I know who you are—the Holy One of God!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Be quiet!” said Jesus sternly. “Come out of him!”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: The impure spirit shook the man violently and came out of him with a shriek.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people were all so amazed that they asked each other, “What is this? A new teaching—and with authority! He even gives orders to impure spirits and they obey him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: News about him spread quickly over the whole region of Galilee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As soon as they left the synagogue, they went with James and John to the home of Simon and Andrew.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simon’s mother-in-law was in bed with a fever, and they immediately told Jesus about her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he went to her, took her hand and helped her up. The fever left her and she began to wait on them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That evening after sunset the people brought to Jesus all the sick and demon-possessed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The whole town gathered at the door,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Jesus healed many who had various diseases. He also drove out many demons, but he would not let the demons speak because they knew who he was.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Very early in the morning, while it was still dark, Jesus got up, left the house and went off to a solitary place, where he prayed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simon and his companions went to look for him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and when they found him, they exclaimed: “Everyone is looking for you!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied, “Let us go somewhere else—to the nearby villages—so I can preach there also. That is why I have come.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: So he traveled throughout Galilee, preaching in their synagogues and driving out demons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A man with leprosy came to him and begged him on his knees, “If you are willing, you can make me clean.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus was indignant. He reached out his hand and touched the man. “I am willing,” he said. “Be clean!”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Immediately the leprosy left him and he was cleansed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus sent him away at once with a strong warning:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “See that you don’t tell this to anyone. But go, show yourself to the priest and offer the sacrifices that Moses commanded for your cleansing, as a testimony to them.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Instead he went out and began to talk freely, spreading the news. As a result, Jesus could no longer enter a town openly but stayed outside in lonely places. Yet the people still came to him from everywhere.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A few days later, when Jesus again entered Capernaum, the people heard that he had come home.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They gathered in such large numbers that there was no room left, not even outside the door, and he preached the word to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some men came, bringing to him a paralyzed man, carried by four of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Since they could not get him to Jesus because of the crowd, they made an opening in the roof above Jesus by digging through it and then lowered the mat the man was lying on.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus saw their faith, he said to the paralyzed man, “Son, your sins are forgiven.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Now some teachers of the law were sitting there, thinking to themselves,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Why does this fellow talk like that? He’s blaspheming! Who can forgive sins but God alone?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Immediately Jesus knew in his spirit that this was what they were thinking in their hearts, and he said to them, “Why are you thinking these things?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Which is easier: to say to this paralyzed man, ‘Your sins are forgiven,’ or to say, ‘Get up, take your mat and walk’?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But I want you to know that the Son of Man has authority on earth to forgive sins.” So he said to the man,
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “I tell you, get up, take your mat and go home.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: He got up, took his mat and walked out in full view of them all. This amazed everyone and they praised God, saying, “We have never seen anything like this!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Once again Jesus went out beside the lake. A large crowd came to him, and he began to teach them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As he walked along, he saw Levi son of Alphaeus sitting at the tax collector’s booth. “Follow me,” Jesus told him, and Levi got up and followed him.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: While Jesus was having dinner at Levi’s house, many tax collectors and sinners were eating with him and his disciples, for there were many who followed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the teachers of the law who were Pharisees saw him eating with the sinners and tax collectors, they asked his disciples: “Why does he eat with tax collectors and sinners?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On hearing this, Jesus said to them, “It is not the healthy who need a doctor, but the sick. I have not come to call the righteous, but sinners.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Now John’s disciples and the Pharisees were fasting. Some people came and asked Jesus, “How is it that John’s disciples and the disciples of the Pharisees are fasting, but yours are not?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered, “How can the guests of the bridegroom fast while he is with them? They cannot, so long as they have him with them.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But the time will come when the bridegroom will be taken from them, and on that day they will fast.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “No one sews a patch of unshrunk cloth on an old garment. Otherwise, the new piece will pull away from the old, making the tear worse.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And no one pours new wine into old wineskins. Otherwise, the wine will burst the skins, and both the wine and the wineskins will be ruined. No, they pour new wine into new wineskins.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: One Sabbath Jesus was going through the grainfields, and as his disciples walked along, they began to pick some heads of grain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Pharisees said to him, “Look, why are they doing what is unlawful on the Sabbath?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He answered, “Have you never read what David did when he and his companions were hungry and in need?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: In the days of Abiathar the high priest, he entered the house of God and ate the consecrated bread, which is lawful only for priests to eat. And he also gave some to his companions.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Then he said to them, “The Sabbath was made for man, not man for the Sabbath.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: So the Son of Man is Lord even of the Sabbath.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Another time Jesus went into the synagogue, and a man with a shriveled hand was there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some of them were looking for a reason to accuse Jesus, so they watched him closely to see if he would heal him on the Sabbath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to the man with the shriveled hand, “Stand up in front of everyone.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus asked them, “Which is lawful on the Sabbath: to do good or to do evil, to save life or to kill?” But they remained silent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He looked around at them in anger and, deeply distressed at their stubborn hearts, said to the man, “Stretch out your hand.” He stretched it out, and his hand was completely restored.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Pharisees went out and began to plot with the Herodians how they might kill Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus withdrew with his disciples to the lake, and a large crowd from Galilee followed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they heard about all he was doing, many people came to him from Judea, Jerusalem, Idumea, and the regions across the Jordan and around Tyre and Sidon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because of the crowd he told his disciples to have a small boat ready for him, to keep the people from crowding him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he had healed many, so that those with diseases were pushing forward to touch him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whenever the impure spirits saw him, they fell down before him and cried out, “You are the Son of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he gave them strict orders not to tell others about him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus went up on a mountainside and called to him those he wanted, and they came to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He appointed twelve that they might be with him and that he might send them out to preach
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and to have authority to drive out demons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the twelve he appointed: Simon (to whom he gave the name Peter),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: James son of Zebedee and his brother John (to them he gave the name Boanerges, which means “sons of thunder”),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Andrew, Philip, Bartholomew, Matthew, Thomas, James son of Alphaeus, Thaddaeus, Simon the Zealot
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Judas Iscariot, who betrayed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus entered a house, and again a crowd gathered, so that he and his disciples were not even able to eat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When his family heard about this, they went to take charge of him, for they said, “He is out of his mind.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the teachers of the law who came down from Jerusalem said, “He is possessed by Beelzebul! By the prince of demons he is driving out demons.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jesus called them over to him and began to speak to them in parables: “How can Satan drive out Satan?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a kingdom is divided against itself, that kingdom cannot stand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a house is divided against itself, that house cannot stand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if Satan opposes himself and is divided, he cannot stand; his end has come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In fact, no one can enter a strong man’s house without first tying him up. Then he can plunder the strong man’s house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Truly I tell you, people can be forgiven all their sins and every slander they utter,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but whoever blasphemes against the Holy Spirit will never be forgiven; they are guilty of an eternal sin.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said this because they were saying, “He has an impure spirit.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus’ mother and brothers arrived. Standing outside, they sent someone in to call him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A crowd was sitting around him, and they told him, “Your mother and brothers are outside looking for you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Who are my mother and my brothers?” he asked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he looked at those seated in a circle around him and said, “Here are my mother and my brothers!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever does God’s will is my brother and sister and mother.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again Jesus began to teach by the lake. The crowd that gathered around him was so large that he got into a boat and sat in it out on the lake, while all the people were along the shore at the water’s edge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He taught them many things by parables, and in his teaching said:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Listen! A farmer went out to sow his seed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As he was scattering the seed, some fell along the path, and the birds came and ate it up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some fell on rocky places, where it did not have much soil. It sprang up quickly, because the soil was shallow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the sun came up, the plants were scorched, and they withered because they had no root.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Other seed fell among thorns, which grew up and choked the plants, so that they did not bear grain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Still other seed fell on good soil. It came up, grew and produced a crop, some multiplying thirty, some sixty, some a hundred times.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said, “Whoever has ears to hear, let them hear.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he was alone, the Twelve and the others around him asked him about the parables.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He told them, “The secret of the kingdom of God has been given to you. But to those on the outside everything is said in parables
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
so that,
“‘they may be ever seeing but never perceiving,
    and ever hearing but never understanding;
otherwise they might turn and be forgiven!’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said to them, “Don’t you understand this parable? How then will you understand any parable?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The farmer sows the word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some people are like seed along the path, where the word is sown. As soon as they hear it, Satan comes and takes away the word that was sown in them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Others, like seed sown on rocky places, hear the word and at once receive it with joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But since they have no root, they last only a short time. When trouble or persecution comes because of the word, they quickly fall away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Still others, like seed sown among thorns, hear the word;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but the worries of this life, the deceitfulness of wealth and the desires for other things come in and choke the word, making it unfruitful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Others, like seed sown on good soil, hear the word, accept it, and produce a crop—some thirty, some sixty, some a hundred times what was sown.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Do you bring in a lamp to put it under a bowl or a bed? Instead, don’t you put it on its stand?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For whatever is hidden is meant to be disclosed, and whatever is concealed is meant to be brought out into the open.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If anyone has ears to hear, let them hear.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Consider carefully what you hear,” he continued. “With the measure you use, it will be measured to you—and even more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever has will be given more; whoever does not have, even what they have will be taken from them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He also said, “This is what the kingdom of God is like. A man scatters seed on the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Night and day, whether he sleeps or gets up, the seed sprouts and grows, though he does not know how.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All by itself the soil produces grain—first the stalk, then the head, then the full kernel in the head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As soon as the grain is ripe, he puts the sickle to it, because the harvest has come.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again he said, “What shall we say the kingdom of God is like, or what parable shall we use to describe it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is like a mustard seed, which is the smallest of all seeds on earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet when planted, it grows and becomes the largest of all garden plants, with such big branches that the birds can perch in its shade.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: With many similar parables Jesus spoke the word to them, as much as they could understand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He did not say anything to them without using a parable. But when he was alone with his own disciples, he explained everything.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That day when evening came, he said to his disciples, “Let us go over to the other side.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Leaving the crowd behind, they took him along, just as he was, in the boat. There were also other boats with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A furious squall came up, and the waves broke over the boat, so that it was nearly swamped.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus was in the stern, sleeping on a cushion. The disciples woke him and said to him, “Teacher, don’t you care if we drown?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He got up, rebuked the wind and said to the waves, “Quiet! Be still!” Then the wind died down and it was completely calm.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to his disciples, “Why are you so afraid? Do you still have no faith?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were terrified and asked each other, “Who is this? Even the wind and the waves obey him!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They went across the lake to the region of the Gerasenes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus got out of the boat, a man with an impure spirit came from the tombs to meet him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This man lived in the tombs, and no one could bind him anymore, not even with a chain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he had often been chained hand and foot, but he tore the chains apart and broke the irons on his feet. No one was strong enough to subdue him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Night and day among the tombs and in the hills he would cry out and cut himself with stones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he saw Jesus from a distance, he ran and fell on his knees in front of him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He shouted at the top of his voice, “What do you want with me, Jesus, Son of the Most High God? In God’s name don’t torture me!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Jesus had said to him, “Come out of this man, you impure spirit!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then Jesus asked him, “What is your name?”
“My name is Legion,” he replied, “for we are many.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he begged Jesus again and again not to send them out of the area.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A large herd of pigs was feeding on the nearby hillside.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The demons begged Jesus, “Send us among the pigs; allow us to go into them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He gave them permission, and the impure spirits came out and went into the pigs. The herd, about two thousand in number, rushed down the steep bank into the lake and were drowned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those tending the pigs ran off and reported this in the town and countryside, and the people went out to see what had happened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they came to Jesus, they saw the man who had been possessed by the legion of demons, sitting there, dressed and in his right mind; and they were afraid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who had seen it told the people what had happened to the demon-possessed man—and told about the pigs as well.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the people began to plead with Jesus to leave their region.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As Jesus was getting into the boat, the man who had been demon-possessed begged to go with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus did not let him, but said, “Go home to your own people and tell them how much the Lord has done for you, and how he has had mercy on you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the man went away and began to tell in the Decapolis how much Jesus had done for him. And all the people were amazed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus had again crossed over by boat to the other side of the lake, a large crowd gathered around him while he was by the lake.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then one of the synagogue leaders, named Jairus, came, and when he saw Jesus, he fell at his feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He pleaded earnestly with him, “My little daughter is dying. Please come and put your hands on her so that she will be healed and live.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So Jesus went with him.
A large crowd followed and pressed around him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And a woman was there who had been subject to bleeding for twelve years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She had suffered a great deal under the care of many doctors and had spent all she had, yet instead of getting better she grew worse.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When she heard about Jesus, she came up behind him in the crowd and touched his cloak,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because she thought, “If I just touch his clothes, I will be healed.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Immediately her bleeding stopped and she felt in her body that she was freed from her suffering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At once Jesus realized that power had gone out from him. He turned around in the crowd and asked, “Who touched my clothes?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You see the people crowding against you,” his disciples answered, “and yet you can ask, ‘Who touched me?’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus kept looking around to see who had done it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the woman, knowing what had happened to her, came and fell at his feet and, trembling with fear, told him the whole truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to her, “Daughter, your faith has healed you. Go in peace and be freed from your suffering.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While Jesus was still speaking, some people came from the house of Jairus, the synagogue leader. “Your daughter is dead,” they said. “Why bother the teacher anymore?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Overhearing what they said, Jesus told him, “Don’t be afraid; just believe.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He did not let anyone follow him except Peter, James and John the brother of James.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they came to the home of the synagogue leader, Jesus saw a commotion, with people crying and wailing loudly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He went in and said to them, “Why all this commotion and wailing? The child is not dead but asleep.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But they laughed at him.
After he put them all out, he took the child’s father and mother and the disciples who were with him, and went in where the child was.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He took her by the hand and said to her, “Talitha koum!” (which means “Little girl, I say to you, get up!”).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Immediately the girl stood up and began to walk around (she was twelve years old). At this they were completely astonished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He gave strict orders not to let anyone know about this, and told them to give her something to eat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus left there and went to his hometown, accompanied by his disciples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When the Sabbath came, he began to teach in the synagogue, and many who heard him were amazed.
“Where did this man get these things?” they asked. “What’s this wisdom that has been given him? What are these remarkable miracles he is performing?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Isn’t this the carpenter? Isn’t this Mary’s son and the brother of James, Joseph, Judas and Simon? Aren’t his sisters here with us?” And they took offense at him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “A prophet is not without honor except in his own town, among his relatives and in his own home.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He could not do any miracles there, except lay his hands on a few sick people and heal them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He was amazed at their lack of faith.
Then Jesus went around teaching from village to village.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Calling the Twelve to him, he began to send them out two by two and gave them authority over impure spirits.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These were his instructions: “Take nothing for the journey except a staff—no bread, no bag, no money in your belts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wear sandals but not an extra shirt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whenever you enter a house, stay there until you leave that town.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if any place will not welcome you or listen to you, leave that place and shake the dust off your feet as a testimony against them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They went out and preached that people should repent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They drove out many demons and anointed many sick people with oil and healed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: King Herod heard about this, for Jesus’ name had become well known. Some were saying, “John the Baptist has been raised from the dead, and that is why miraculous powers are at work in him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Others said, “He is Elijah.”
And still others claimed, “He is a prophet, like one of the prophets of long ago.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when Herod heard this, he said, “John, whom I beheaded, has been raised from the dead!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Herod himself had given orders to have John arrested, and he had him bound and put in prison. He did this because of Herodias, his brother Philip’s wife, whom he had married.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For John had been saying to Herod, “It is not lawful for you to have your brother’s wife.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Herodias nursed a grudge against John and wanted to kill him. But she was not able to,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because Herod feared John and protected him, knowing him to be a righteous and holy man. When Herod heard John, he was greatly puzzled; yet he liked to listen to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Finally the opportune time came. On his birthday Herod gave a banquet for his high officials and military commanders and the leading men of Galilee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When the daughter of Herodias came in and danced, she pleased Herod and his dinner guests.
The king said to the girl, “Ask me for anything you want, and I’ll give it to you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he promised her with an oath, “Whatever you ask I will give you, up to half my kingdom.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
She went out and said to her mother, “What shall I ask for?”
“The head of John the Baptist,” she answered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At once the girl hurried in to the king with the request: “I want you to give me right now the head of John the Baptist on a platter.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The king was greatly distressed, but because of his oaths and his dinner guests, he did not want to refuse her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he immediately sent an executioner with orders to bring John’s head. The man went, beheaded John in the prison,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and brought back his head on a platter. He presented it to the girl, and she gave it to her mother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On hearing of this, John’s disciples came and took his body and laid it in a tomb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The apostles gathered around Jesus and reported to him all they had done and taught.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then, because so many people were coming and going that they did not even have a chance to eat, he said to them, “Come with me by yourselves to a quiet place and get some rest.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they went away by themselves in a boat to a solitary place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But many who saw them leaving recognized them and ran on foot from all the towns and got there ahead of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus landed and saw a large crowd, he had compassion on them, because they were like sheep without a shepherd. So he began teaching them many things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By this time it was late in the day, so his disciples came to him. “This is a remote place,” they said, “and it’s already very late.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Send the people away so that they can go to the surrounding countryside and villages and buy themselves something to eat.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But he answered, “You give them something to eat.”
They said to him, “That would take more than half a year’s wages! Are we to go and spend that much on bread and give it to them to eat?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“How many loaves do you have?” he asked. “Go and see.”
When they found out, they said, “Five—and two fish.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus directed them to have all the people sit down in groups on the green grass.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they sat down in groups of hundreds and fifties.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Taking the five loaves and the two fish and looking up to heaven, he gave thanks and broke the loaves. Then he gave them to his disciples to distribute to the people. He also divided the two fish among them all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They all ate and were satisfied,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the disciples picked up twelve basketfuls of broken pieces of bread and fish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The number of the men who had eaten was five thousand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Immediately Jesus made his disciples get into the boat and go on ahead of him to Bethsaida, while he dismissed the crowd.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After leaving them, he went up on a mountainside to pray.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Later that night, the boat was in the middle of the lake, and he was alone on land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He saw the disciples straining at the oars, because the wind was against them. Shortly before dawn he went out to them, walking on the lake. He was about to pass by them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but when they saw him walking on the lake, they thought he was a ghost. They cried out,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
because they all saw him and were terrified.
Immediately he spoke to them and said, “Take courage! It is I. Don’t be afraid.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he climbed into the boat with them, and the wind died down. They were completely amazed,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for they had not understood about the loaves; their hearts were hardened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they had crossed over, they landed at Gennesaret and anchored there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As soon as they got out of the boat, people recognized Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They ran throughout that whole region and carried the sick on mats to wherever they heard he was.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And wherever he went—into villages, towns or countryside—they placed the sick in the marketplaces. They begged him to let them touch even the edge of his cloak, and all who touched it were healed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Pharisees and some of the teachers of the law who had come from Jerusalem gathered around Jesus
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and saw some of his disciples eating food with hands that were defiled, that is, unwashed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (The Pharisees and all the Jews do not eat unless they give their hands a ceremonial washing, holding to the tradition of the elders.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they come from the marketplace they do not eat unless they wash. And they observe many other traditions, such as the washing of cups, pitchers and kettles.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Pharisees and teachers of the law asked Jesus, “Why don’t your disciples live according to the tradition of the elders instead of eating their food with defiled hands?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He replied, “Isaiah was right when he prophesied about you hypocrites; as it is written:
“‘These people honor me with their lips,
    but their hearts are far from me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They worship me in vain;
    their teachings are merely human rules.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You have let go of the commands of God and are holding on to human traditions.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he continued, “You have a fine way of setting aside the commands of God in order to observe your own traditions!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Moses said, ‘Honor your father and mother,’ and, ‘Anyone who curses their father or mother is to be put to death.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you say that if anyone declares that what might have been used to help their father or mother is Corban (that is, devoted to God)—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then you no longer let them do anything for their father or mother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus you nullify the word of God by your tradition that you have handed down. And you do many things like that.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again Jesus called the crowd to him and said, “Listen to me, everyone, and understand this.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nothing outside a person can defile them by going into them. Rather, it is what comes out of a person that defiles them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After he had left the crowd and entered the house, his disciples asked him about this parable.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Are you so dull?” he asked. “Don’t you see that nothing that enters a person from the outside can defile them?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For it doesn’t go into their heart but into their stomach, and then out of the body.” (In saying this, Jesus declared all foods clean.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He went on: “What comes out of a person is what defiles them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For it is from within, out of a person’s heart, that evil thoughts come—sexual immorality, theft, murder,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: adultery, greed, malice, deceit, lewdness, envy, slander, arrogance and folly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All these evils come from inside and defile a person.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus left that place and went to the vicinity of Tyre. He entered a house and did not want anyone to know it; yet he could not keep his presence secret.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In fact, as soon as she heard about him, a woman whose little daughter was possessed by an impure spirit came and fell at his feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The woman was a Greek, born in Syrian Phoenicia. She begged Jesus to drive the demon out of her daughter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “First let the children eat all they want,” he told her, “for it is not right to take the children’s bread and toss it to the dogs.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Lord,” she replied, “even the dogs under the table eat the children’s crumbs.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he told her, “For such a reply, you may go; the demon has left your daughter.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She went home and found her child lying on the bed, and the demon gone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus left the vicinity of Tyre and went through Sidon, down to the Sea of Galilee and into the region of the Decapolis.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There some people brought to him a man who was deaf and could hardly talk, and they begged Jesus to place his hand on him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After he took him aside, away from the crowd, Jesus put his fingers into the man’s ears. Then he spit and touched the man’s tongue.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He looked up to heaven and with a deep sigh said to him, “Ephphatha!” (which means “Be opened!”).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At this, the man’s ears were opened, his tongue was loosened and he began to speak plainly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus commanded them not to tell anyone. But the more he did so, the more they kept talking about it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: People were overwhelmed with amazement. “He has done everything well,” they said. “He even makes the deaf hear and the mute speak.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: During those days another large crowd gathered. Since they had nothing to eat, Jesus called his disciples to him and said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I have compassion for these people; they have already been with me three days and have nothing to eat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If I send them home hungry, they will collapse on the way, because some of them have come a long distance.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His disciples answered, “But where in this remote place can anyone get enough bread to feed them?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“How many loaves do you have?” Jesus asked.
“Seven,” they replied.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He told the crowd to sit down on the ground. When he had taken the seven loaves and given thanks, he broke them and gave them to his disciples to distribute to the people, and they did so.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They had a few small fish as well; he gave thanks for them also and told the disciples to distribute them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people ate and were satisfied. Afterward the disciples picked up seven basketfuls of broken pieces that were left over.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: About four thousand were present. After he had sent them away,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he got into the boat with his disciples and went to the region of Dalmanutha.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Pharisees came and began to question Jesus. To test him, they asked him for a sign from heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He sighed deeply and said, “Why does this generation ask for a sign? Truly I tell you, no sign will be given to it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he left them, got back into the boat and crossed to the other side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The disciples had forgotten to bring bread, except for one loaf they had with them in the boat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Be careful,” Jesus warned them. “Watch out for the yeast of the Pharisees and that of Herod.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They discussed this with one another and said, “It is because we have no bread.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Aware of their discussion, Jesus asked them: “Why are you talking about having no bread? Do you still not see or understand? Are your hearts hardened?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do you have eyes but fail to see, and ears but fail to hear? And don’t you remember?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When I broke the five loaves for the five thousand, how many basketfuls of pieces did you pick up?”
“Twelve,” they replied.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“And when I broke the seven loaves for the four thousand, how many basketfuls of pieces did you pick up?”
They answered, “Seven.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Do you still not understand?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They came to Bethsaida, and some people brought a blind man and begged Jesus to touch him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He took the blind man by the hand and led him outside the village. When he had spit on the man’s eyes and put his hands on him, Jesus asked, “Do you see anything?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He looked up and said, “I see people; they look like trees walking around.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Once more Jesus put his hands on the man’s eyes. Then his eyes were opened, his sight was restored, and he saw everything clearly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus sent him home, saying, “Don’t even go into the village.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus and his disciples went on to the villages around Caesarea Philippi. On the way he asked them, “Who do people say I am?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They replied, “Some say John the Baptist; others say Elijah; and still others, one of the prophets.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“But what about you?” he asked. “Who do you say I am?”
Peter answered, “You are the Messiah.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus warned them not to tell anyone about him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He then began to teach them that the Son of Man must suffer many things and be rejected by the elders, the chief priests and the teachers of the law, and that he must be killed and after three days rise again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He spoke plainly about this, and Peter took him aside and began to rebuke him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when Jesus turned and looked at his disciples, he rebuked Peter. “Get behind me, Satan!” he said. “You do not have in mind the concerns of God, but merely human concerns.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he called the crowd to him along with his disciples and said: “Whoever wants to be my disciple must deny themselves and take up their cross and follow me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For whoever wants to save their life will lose it, but whoever loses their life for me and for the gospel will save it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What good is it for someone to gain the whole world, yet forfeit their soul?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or what can anyone give in exchange for their soul?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If anyone is ashamed of me and my words in this adulterous and sinful generation, the Son of Man will be ashamed of them when he comes in his Father’s glory with the holy angels.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to them, “Truly I tell you, some who are standing here will not taste death before they see that the kingdom of God has come with power.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After six days Jesus took Peter, James and John with him and led them up a high mountain, where they were all alone. There he was transfigured before them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His clothes became dazzling white, whiter than anyone in the world could bleach them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there appeared before them Elijah and Moses, who were talking with Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter said to Jesus, “Rabbi, it is good for us to be here. Let us put up three shelters—one for you, one for Moses and one for Elijah.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (He did not know what to say, they were so frightened.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then a cloud appeared and covered them, and a voice came from the cloud: “This is my Son, whom I love. Listen to him!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Suddenly, when they looked around, they no longer saw anyone with them except Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As they were coming down the mountain, Jesus gave them orders not to tell anyone what they had seen until the Son of Man had risen from the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They kept the matter to themselves, discussing what “rising from the dead” meant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they asked him, “Why do the teachers of the law say that Elijah must come first?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied, “To be sure, Elijah does come first, and restores all things. Why then is it written that the Son of Man must suffer much and be rejected?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I tell you, Elijah has come, and they have done to him everything they wished, just as it is written about him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they came to the other disciples, they saw a large crowd around them and the teachers of the law arguing with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As soon as all the people saw Jesus, they were overwhelmed with wonder and ran to greet him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “What are you arguing with them about?” he asked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A man in the crowd answered, “Teacher, I brought you my son, who is possessed by a spirit that has robbed him of speech.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whenever it seizes him, it throws him to the ground. He foams at the mouth, gnashes his teeth and becomes rigid. I asked your disciples to drive out the spirit, but they could not.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You unbelieving generation,” Jesus replied, “how long shall I stay with you? How long shall I put up with you? Bring the boy to me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they brought him. When the spirit saw Jesus, it immediately threw the boy into a convulsion. He fell to the ground and rolled around, foaming at the mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jesus asked the boy’s father, “How long has he been like this?”
“From childhood,” he answered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “It has often thrown him into fire or water to kill him. But if you can do anything, take pity on us and help us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘If you can’?” said Jesus. “Everything is possible for one who believes.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Immediately the boy’s father exclaimed, “I do believe; help me overcome my unbelief!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus saw that a crowd was running to the scene, he rebuked the impure spirit. “You deaf and mute spirit,” he said, “I command you, come out of him and never enter him again.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The spirit shrieked, convulsed him violently and came out. The boy looked so much like a corpse that many said, “He’s dead.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus took him by the hand and lifted him to his feet, and he stood up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After Jesus had gone indoors, his disciples asked him privately, “Why couldn’t we drive it out?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He replied, “This kind can come out only by prayer.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They left that place and passed through Galilee. Jesus did not want anyone to know where they were,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because he was teaching his disciples. He said to them, “The Son of Man is going to be delivered into the hands of men. They will kill him, and after three days he will rise.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they did not understand what he meant and were afraid to ask him about it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They came to Capernaum. When he was in the house, he asked them, “What were you arguing about on the road?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they kept quiet because on the way they had argued about who was the greatest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Sitting down, Jesus called the Twelve and said, “Anyone who wants to be first must be the very last, and the servant of all.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He took a little child whom he placed among them. Taking the child in his arms, he said to them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Whoever welcomes one of these little children in my name welcomes me; and whoever welcomes me does not welcome me but the one who sent me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Teacher,” said John, “we saw someone driving out demons in your name and we told him to stop, because he was not one of us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Do not stop him,” Jesus said. “For no one who does a miracle in my name can in the next moment say anything bad about me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for whoever is not against us is for us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Truly I tell you, anyone who gives you a cup of water in my name because you belong to the Messiah will certainly not lose their reward.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If anyone causes one of these little ones—those who believe in me—to stumble, it would be better for them if a large millstone were hung around their neck and they were thrown into the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If your hand causes you to stumble, cut it off. It is better for you to enter life maimed than with two hands to go into hell, where the fire never goes out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if your foot causes you to stumble, cut it off. It is better for you to enter life crippled than to have two feet and be thrown into hell.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if your eye causes you to stumble, pluck it out. It is better for you to enter the kingdom of God with one eye than to have two eyes and be thrown into hell,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
where
“‘the worms that eat them do not die,
    and the fire is not quenched.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Everyone will be salted with fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Salt is good, but if it loses its saltiness, how can you make it salty again? Have salt among yourselves, and be at peace with each other.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus then left that place and went into the region of Judea and across the Jordan. Again crowds of people came to him, and as was his custom, he taught them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some Pharisees came and tested him by asking, “Is it lawful for a man to divorce his wife?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “What did Moses command you?” he replied.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said, “Moses permitted a man to write a certificate of divorce and send her away.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “It was because your hearts were hard that Moses wrote you this law,” Jesus replied.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But at the beginning of creation God ‘made them male and female.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘For this reason a man will leave his father and mother and be united to his wife,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the two will become one flesh.’ So they are no longer two, but one flesh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore what God has joined together, let no one separate.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they were in the house again, the disciples asked Jesus about this.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He answered, “Anyone who divorces his wife and marries another woman commits adultery against her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if she divorces her husband and marries another man, she commits adultery.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: People were bringing little children to Jesus for him to place his hands on them, but the disciples rebuked them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus saw this, he was indignant. He said to them, “Let the little children come to me, and do not hinder them, for the kingdom of God belongs to such as these.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Truly I tell you, anyone who will not receive the kingdom of God like a little child will never enter it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he took the children in his arms, placed his hands on them and blessed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As Jesus started on his way, a man ran up to him and fell on his knees before him. “Good teacher,” he asked, “what must I do to inherit eternal life?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Why do you call me good?” Jesus answered. “No one is good—except God alone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You know the commandments: ‘You shall not murder, you shall not commit adultery, you shall not steal, you shall not give false testimony, you shall not defraud, honor your father and mother.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Teacher,” he declared, “all these I have kept since I was a boy.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus looked at him and loved him. “One thing you lack,” he said. “Go, sell everything you have and give to the poor, and you will have treasure in heaven. Then come, follow me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At this the man’s face fell. He went away sad, because he had great wealth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus looked around and said to his disciples, “How hard it is for the rich to enter the kingdom of God!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The disciples were amazed at his words. But Jesus said again, “Children, how hard it is to enter the kingdom of God!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle than for someone who is rich to enter the kingdom of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The disciples were even more amazed, and said to each other, “Who then can be saved?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus looked at them and said, “With man this is impossible, but not with God; all things are possible with God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Peter spoke up, “We have left everything to follow you!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Truly I tell you,” Jesus replied, “no one who has left home or brothers or sisters or mother or father or children or fields for me and the gospel
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: will fail to receive a hundred times as much in this present age: homes, brothers, sisters, mothers, children and fields—along with persecutions—and in the age to come eternal life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But many who are first will be last, and the last first.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were on their way up to Jerusalem, with Jesus leading the way, and the disciples were astonished, while those who followed were afraid. Again he took the Twelve aside and told them what was going to happen to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “We are going up to Jerusalem,” he said, “and the Son of Man will be delivered over to the chief priests and the teachers of the law. They will condemn him to death and will hand him over to the Gentiles,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who will mock him and spit on him, flog him and kill him. Three days later he will rise.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then James and John, the sons of Zebedee, came to him. “Teacher,” they said, “we want you to do for us whatever we ask.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “What do you want me to do for you?” he asked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They replied, “Let one of us sit at your right and the other at your left in your glory.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You don’t know what you are asking,” Jesus said. “Can you drink the cup I drink or be baptized with the baptism I am baptized with?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“We can,” they answered.
Jesus said to them, “You will drink the cup I drink and be baptized with the baptism I am baptized with,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but to sit at my right or left is not for me to grant. These places belong to those for whom they have been prepared.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the ten heard about this, they became indignant with James and John.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus called them together and said, “You know that those who are regarded as rulers of the Gentiles lord it over them, and their high officials exercise authority over them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Not so with you. Instead, whoever wants to become great among you must be your servant,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and whoever wants to be first must be slave of all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For even the Son of Man did not come to be served, but to serve, and to give his life as a ransom for many.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they came to Jericho. As Jesus and his disciples, together with a large crowd, were leaving the city, a blind man, Bartimaeus (which means “son of Timaeus”), was sitting by the roadside begging.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he heard that it was Jesus of Nazareth, he began to shout, “Jesus, Son of David, have mercy on me!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Many rebuked him and told him to be quiet, but he shouted all the more, “Son of David, have mercy on me!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jesus stopped and said, “Call him.”
So they called to the blind man, “Cheer up! On your feet! He’s calling you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Throwing his cloak aside, he jumped to his feet and came to Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“What do you want me to do for you?” Jesus asked him.
The blind man said, “Rabbi, I want to see.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Go,” said Jesus, “your faith has healed you.” Immediately he received his sight and followed Jesus along the road.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As they approached Jerusalem and came to Bethphage and Bethany at the Mount of Olives, Jesus sent two of his disciples,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying to them, “Go to the village ahead of you, and just as you enter it, you will find a colt tied there, which no one has ever ridden. Untie it and bring it here.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If anyone asks you, ‘Why are you doing this?’ say, ‘The Lord needs it and will send it back here shortly.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They went and found a colt outside in the street, tied at a doorway. As they untied it,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: some people standing there asked, “What are you doing, untying that colt?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They answered as Jesus had told them to, and the people let them go.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they brought the colt to Jesus and threw their cloaks over it, he sat on it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Many people spread their cloaks on the road, while others spread branches they had cut in the fields.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Those who went ahead and those who followed shouted,
“Hosanna!”
“Blessed is he who comes in the name of the Lord!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Blessed is the coming kingdom of our father David!”
“Hosanna in the highest heaven!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus entered Jerusalem and went into the temple courts. He looked around at everything, but since it was already late, he went out to Bethany with the Twelve.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The next day as they were leaving Bethany, Jesus was hungry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Seeing in the distance a fig tree in leaf, he went to find out if it had any fruit. When he reached it, he found nothing but leaves, because it was not the season for figs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said to the tree, “May no one ever eat fruit from you again.” And his disciples heard him say it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On reaching Jerusalem, Jesus entered the temple courts and began driving out those who were buying and selling there. He overturned the tables of the money changers and the benches of those selling doves,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and would not allow anyone to carry merchandise through the temple courts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as he taught them, he said, “Is it not written: ‘My house will be called a house of prayer for all nations’? But you have made it ‘a den of robbers.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The chief priests and the teachers of the law heard this and began looking for a way to kill him, for they feared him, because the whole crowd was amazed at his teaching.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When evening came, Jesus and his disciples went out of the city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the morning, as they went along, they saw the fig tree withered from the roots.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter remembered and said to Jesus, “Rabbi, look! The fig tree you cursed has withered!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Have faith in God,” Jesus answered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Truly I tell you, if anyone says to this mountain, ‘Go, throw yourself into the sea,’ and does not doubt in their heart but believes that what they say will happen, it will be done for them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore I tell you, whatever you ask for in prayer, believe that you have received it, and it will be yours.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when you stand praying, if you hold anything against anyone, forgive them, so that your Father in heaven may forgive you your sins.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They arrived again in Jerusalem, and while Jesus was walking in the temple courts, the chief priests, the teachers of the law and the elders came to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “By what authority are you doing these things?” they asked. “And who gave you authority to do this?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied, “I will ask you one question. Answer me, and I will tell you by what authority I am doing these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: John’s baptism—was it from heaven, or of human origin? Tell me!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They discussed it among themselves and said, “If we say, ‘From heaven,’ he will ask, ‘Then why didn’t you believe him?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if we say, ‘Of human origin’ …” (They feared the people, for everyone held that John really was a prophet.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So they answered Jesus, “We don’t know.”
Jesus said, “Neither will I tell you by what authority I am doing these things.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus then began to speak to them in parables: “A man planted a vineyard. He put a wall around it, dug a pit for the winepress and built a watchtower. Then he rented the vineyard to some farmers and moved to another place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At harvest time he sent a servant to the tenants to collect from them some of the fruit of the vineyard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they seized him, beat him and sent him away empty-handed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he sent another servant to them; they struck this man on the head and treated him shamefully.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He sent still another, and that one they killed. He sent many others; some of them they beat, others they killed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “He had one left to send, a son, whom he loved. He sent him last of all, saying, ‘They will respect my son.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But the tenants said to one another, ‘This is the heir. Come, let’s kill him, and the inheritance will be ours.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they took him and killed him, and threw him out of the vineyard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “What then will the owner of the vineyard do? He will come and kill those tenants and give the vineyard to others.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
the Lord has done this,
    and it is marvelous in our eyes’?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the chief priests, the teachers of the law and the elders looked for a way to arrest him because they knew he had spoken the parable against them. But they were afraid of the crowd; so they left him and went away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Later they sent some of the Pharisees and Herodians to Jesus to catch him in his words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They came to him and said, “Teacher, we know that you are a man of integrity. You aren’t swayed by others, because you pay no attention to who they are; but you teach the way of God in accordance with the truth. Is it right to pay the imperial tax to Caesar or not?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Should we pay or shouldn’t we?”
But Jesus knew their hypocrisy. “Why are you trying to trap me?” he asked. “Bring me a denarius and let me look at it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They brought the coin, and he asked them, “Whose image is this? And whose inscription?”
“Caesar’s,” they replied.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then Jesus said to them, “Give back to Caesar what is Caesar’s and to God what is God’s.”
And they were amazed at him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Sadducees, who say there is no resurrection, came to him with a question.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Teacher,” they said, “Moses wrote for us that if a man’s brother dies and leaves a wife but no children, the man must marry the widow and raise up offspring for his brother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now there were seven brothers. The first one married and died without leaving any children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The second one married the widow, but he also died, leaving no child. It was the same with the third.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In fact, none of the seven left any children. Last of all, the woman died too.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At the resurrection whose wife will she be, since the seven were married to her?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied, “Are you not in error because you do not know the Scriptures or the power of God?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the dead rise, they will neither marry nor be given in marriage; they will be like the angels in heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now about the dead rising—have you not read in the Book of Moses, in the account of the burning bush, how God said to him, ‘I am the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He is not the God of the dead, but of the living. You are badly mistaken!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One of the teachers of the law came and heard them debating. Noticing that Jesus had given them a good answer, he asked him, “Of all the commandments, which is the most important?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The most important one,” answered Jesus, “is this: ‘Hear, O Israel: The Lord our God, the Lord is one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Love the Lord your God with all your heart and with all your soul and with all your mind and with all your strength.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The second is this: ‘Love your neighbor as yourself.’ There is no commandment greater than these.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Well said, teacher,” the man replied. “You are right in saying that God is one and there is no other but him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To love him with all your heart, with all your understanding and with all your strength, and to love your neighbor as yourself is more important than all burnt offerings and sacrifices.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus saw that he had answered wisely, he said to him, “You are not far from the kingdom of God.” And from then on no one dared ask him any more questions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While Jesus was teaching in the temple courts, he asked, “Why do the teachers of the law say that the Messiah is the son of David?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
David himself, speaking by the Holy Spirit, declared:
“‘The Lord said to my Lord:
    “Sit at my right hand
until I put your enemies
    under your feet.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
David himself calls him ‘Lord.’ How then can he be his son?”
The large crowd listened to him with delight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As he taught, Jesus said, “Watch out for the teachers of the law. They like to walk around in flowing robes and be greeted with respect in the marketplaces,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and have the most important seats in the synagogues and the places of honor at banquets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They devour widows’ houses and for a show make lengthy prayers. These men will be punished most severely.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus sat down opposite the place where the offerings were put and watched the crowd putting their money into the temple treasury. Many rich people threw in large amounts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But a poor widow came and put in two very small copper coins, worth only a few cents.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Calling his disciples to him, Jesus said, “Truly I tell you, this poor widow has put more into the treasury than all the others.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They all gave out of their wealth; but she, out of her poverty, put in everything—all she had to live on.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As Jesus was leaving the temple, one of his disciples said to him, “Look, Teacher! What massive stones! What magnificent buildings!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Do you see all these great buildings?” replied Jesus. “Not one stone here will be left on another; every one will be thrown down.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As Jesus was sitting on the Mount of Olives opposite the temple, Peter, James, John and Andrew asked him privately,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Tell us, when will these things happen? And what will be the sign that they are all about to be fulfilled?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them: “Watch out that no one deceives you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Many will come in my name, claiming, ‘I am he,’ and will deceive many.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you hear of wars and rumors of wars, do not be alarmed. Such things must happen, but the end is still to come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nation will rise against nation, and kingdom against kingdom. There will be earthquakes in various places, and famines. These are the beginning of birth pains.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You must be on your guard. You will be handed over to the local councils and flogged in the synagogues. On account of me you will stand before governors and kings as witnesses to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the gospel must first be preached to all nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whenever you are arrested and brought to trial, do not worry beforehand about what to say. Just say whatever is given you at the time, for it is not you speaking, but the Holy Spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Brother will betray brother to death, and a father his child. Children will rebel against their parents and have them put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Everyone will hate you because of me, but the one who stands firm to the end will be saved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When you see ‘the abomination that causes desolation’ standing where it does not belong—let the reader understand—then let those who are in Judea flee to the mountains.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let no one on the housetop go down or enter the house to take anything out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let no one in the field go back to get their cloak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How dreadful it will be in those days for pregnant women and nursing mothers!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pray that this will not take place in winter,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because those will be days of distress unequaled from the beginning, when God created the world, until now—and never to be equaled again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If the Lord had not cut short those days, no one would survive. But for the sake of the elect, whom he has chosen, he has shortened them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time if anyone says to you, ‘Look, here is the Messiah!’ or, ‘Look, there he is!’ do not believe it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For false messiahs and false prophets will appear and perform signs and wonders to deceive, if possible, even the elect.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So be on your guard; I have told you everything ahead of time.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
the stars will fall from the sky,
    and the heavenly bodies will be shaken.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “At that time people will see the Son of Man coming in clouds with great power and glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he will send his angels and gather his elect from the four winds, from the ends of the earth to the ends of the heavens.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now learn this lesson from the fig tree: As soon as its twigs get tender and its leaves come out, you know that summer is near.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even so, when you see these things happening, you know that it is near, right at the door.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Truly I tell you, this generation will certainly not pass away until all these things have happened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Heaven and earth will pass away, but my words will never pass away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But about that day or hour no one knows, not even the angels in heaven, nor the Son, but only the Father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be on guard! Be alert! You do not know when that time will come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It’s like a man going away: He leaves his house and puts his servants in charge, each with their assigned task, and tells the one at the door to keep watch.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Therefore keep watch because you do not know when the owner of the house will come back—whether in the evening, or at midnight, or when the rooster crows, or at dawn.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If he comes suddenly, do not let him find you sleeping.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What I say to you, I say to everyone: ‘Watch!’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the Passover and the Festival of Unleavened Bread were only two days away, and the chief priests and the teachers of the law were scheming to arrest Jesus secretly and kill him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But not during the festival,” they said, “or the people may riot.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While he was in Bethany, reclining at the table in the home of Simon the Leper, a woman came with an alabaster jar of very expensive perfume, made of pure nard. She broke the jar and poured the perfume on his head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some of those present were saying indignantly to one another, “Why this waste of perfume?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It could have been sold for more than a year’s wages and the money given to the poor.” And they rebuked her harshly.
verses.speaker: Narrator
