verses.text: “Leave her alone,” said Jesus. “Why are you bothering her? She has done a beautiful thing to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The poor you will always have with you, and you can help them any time you want. But you will not always have me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She did what she could. She poured perfume on my body beforehand to prepare for my burial.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Truly I tell you, wherever the gospel is preached throughout the world, what she has done will also be told, in memory of her.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Judas Iscariot, one of the Twelve, went to the chief priests to betray Jesus to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were delighted to hear this and promised to give him money. So he watched for an opportunity to hand him over.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the first day of the Festival of Unleavened Bread, when it was customary to sacrifice the Passover lamb, Jesus’ disciples asked him, “Where do you want us to go and make preparations for you to eat the Passover?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he sent two of his disciples, telling them, “Go into the city, and a man carrying a jar of water will meet you. Follow him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Say to the owner of the house he enters, ‘The Teacher asks: Where is my guest room, where I may eat the Passover with my disciples?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will show you a large room upstairs, furnished and ready. Make preparations for us there.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The disciples left, went into the city and found things just as Jesus had told them. So they prepared the Passover.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When evening came, Jesus arrived with the Twelve.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While they were reclining at the table eating, he said, “Truly I tell you, one of you will betray me—one who is eating with me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were saddened, and one by one they said to him, “Surely you don’t mean me?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “It is one of the Twelve,” he replied, “one who dips bread into the bowl with me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Son of Man will go just as it is written about him. But woe to that man who betrays the Son of Man! It would be better for him if he had not been born.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While they were eating, Jesus took bread, and when he had given thanks, he broke it and gave it to his disciples, saying, “Take it; this is my body.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he took a cup, and when he had given thanks, he gave it to them, and they all drank from it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “This is my blood of the covenant, which is poured out for many,” he said to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Truly I tell you, I will not drink again from the fruit of the vine until that day when I drink it new in the kingdom of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they had sung a hymn, they went out to the Mount of Olives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“You will all fall away,” Jesus told them, “for it is written:
“‘I will strike the shepherd,
    and the sheep will be scattered.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But after I have risen, I will go ahead of you into Galilee.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter declared, “Even if all fall away, I will not.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Truly I tell you,” Jesus answered, “today—yes, tonight—before the rooster crows twice you yourself will disown me three times.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Peter insisted emphatically, “Even if I have to die with you, I will never disown you.” And all the others said the same.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They went to a place called Gethsemane, and Jesus said to his disciples, “Sit here while I pray.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He took Peter, James and John along with him, and he began to be deeply distressed and troubled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “My soul is overwhelmed with sorrow to the point of death,” he said to them. “Stay here and keep watch.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Going a little farther, he fell to the ground and prayed that if possible the hour might pass from him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Abba, Father,” he said, “everything is possible for you. Take this cup from me. Yet not what I will, but what you will.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he returned to his disciples and found them sleeping. “Simon,” he said to Peter, “are you asleep? Couldn’t you keep watch for one hour?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Watch and pray so that you will not fall into temptation. The spirit is willing, but the flesh is weak.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Once more he went away and prayed the same thing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he came back, he again found them sleeping, because their eyes were heavy. They did not know what to say to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Returning the third time, he said to them, “Are you still sleeping and resting? Enough! The hour has come. Look, the Son of Man is delivered into the hands of sinners.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Rise! Let us go! Here comes my betrayer!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Just as he was speaking, Judas, one of the Twelve, appeared. With him was a crowd armed with swords and clubs, sent from the chief priests, the teachers of the law, and the elders.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the betrayer had arranged a signal with them: “The one I kiss is the man; arrest him and lead him away under guard.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Going at once to Jesus, Judas said, “Rabbi!” and kissed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The men seized Jesus and arrested him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then one of those standing near drew his sword and struck the servant of the high priest, cutting off his ear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Am I leading a rebellion,” said Jesus, “that you have come out with swords and clubs to capture me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Every day I was with you, teaching in the temple courts, and you did not arrest me. But the Scriptures must be fulfilled.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then everyone deserted him and fled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A young man, wearing nothing but a linen garment, was following Jesus. When they seized him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he fled naked, leaving his garment behind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They took Jesus to the high priest, and all the chief priests, the elders and the teachers of the law came together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter followed him at a distance, right into the courtyard of the high priest. There he sat with the guards and warmed himself at the fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The chief priests and the whole Sanhedrin were looking for evidence against Jesus so that they could put him to death, but they did not find any.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Many testified falsely against him, but their statements did not agree.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then some stood up and gave this false testimony against him:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “We heard him say, ‘I will destroy this temple made with human hands and in three days will build another, not made with hands.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet even then their testimony did not agree.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the high priest stood up before them and asked Jesus, “Are you not going to answer? What is this testimony that these men are bringing against you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But Jesus remained silent and gave no answer.
Again the high priest asked him, “Are you the Messiah, the Son of the Blessed One?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I am,” said Jesus. “And you will see the Son of Man sitting at the right hand of the Mighty One and coming on the clouds of heaven.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The high priest tore his clothes. “Why do we need any more witnesses?” he asked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“You have heard the blasphemy. What do you think?”
They all condemned him as worthy of death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then some began to spit at him; they blindfolded him, struck him with their fists, and said, “Prophesy!” And the guards took him and beat him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While Peter was below in the courtyard, one of the servant girls of the high priest came by.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When she saw Peter warming himself, she looked closely at him.
“You also were with that Nazarene, Jesus,” she said.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he denied it. “I don’t know or understand what you’re talking about,” he said, and went out into the entryway.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the servant girl saw him there, she said again to those standing around, “This fellow is one of them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Again he denied it.
After a little while, those standing near said to Peter, “Surely you are one of them, for you are a Galilean.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He began to call down curses, and he swore to them, “I don’t know this man you’re talking about.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Immediately the rooster crowed the second time. Then Peter remembered the word Jesus had spoken to him: “Before the rooster crows twice you will disown me three times.” And he broke down and wept.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Very early in the morning, the chief priests, with the elders, the teachers of the law and the whole Sanhedrin, made their plans. So they bound Jesus, led him away and handed him over to Pilate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Are you the king of the Jews?” asked Pilate.
“You have said so,” Jesus replied.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The chief priests accused him of many things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So again Pilate asked him, “Aren’t you going to answer? See how many things they are accusing you of.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus still made no reply, and Pilate was amazed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now it was the custom at the festival to release a prisoner whom the people requested.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A man called Barabbas was in prison with the insurrectionists who had committed murder in the uprising.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The crowd came up and asked Pilate to do for them what he usually did.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Do you want me to release to you the king of the Jews?” asked Pilate,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: knowing it was out of self-interest that the chief priests had handed Jesus over to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the chief priests stirred up the crowd to have Pilate release Barabbas instead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “What shall I do, then, with the one you call the king of the Jews?” Pilate asked them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Crucify him!” they shouted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Why? What crime has he committed?” asked Pilate.
But they shouted all the louder, “Crucify him!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wanting to satisfy the crowd, Pilate released Barabbas to them. He had Jesus flogged, and handed him over to be crucified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The soldiers led Jesus away into the palace (that is, the Praetorium) and called together the whole company of soldiers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They put a purple robe on him, then twisted together a crown of thorns and set it on him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they began to call out to him, “Hail, king of the Jews!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again and again they struck him on the head with a staff and spit on him. Falling on their knees, they paid homage to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they had mocked him, they took off the purple robe and put his own clothes on him. Then they led him out to crucify him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A certain man from Cyrene, Simon, the father of Alexander and Rufus, was passing by on his way in from the country, and they forced him to carry the cross.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They brought Jesus to the place called Golgotha (which means “the place of the skull”).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they offered him wine mixed with myrrh, but he did not take it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they crucified him. Dividing up his clothes, they cast lots to see what each would get.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It was nine in the morning when they crucified him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The written notice of the charge against him read: the king of the jews.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They crucified two rebels with him, one on his right and one on his left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who passed by hurled insults at him, shaking their heads and saying, “So! You who are going to destroy the temple and build it in three days,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: come down from the cross and save yourself!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the same way the chief priests and the teachers of the law mocked him among themselves. “He saved others,” they said, “but he can’t save himself!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let this Messiah, this king of Israel, come down now from the cross, that we may see and believe.” Those crucified with him also heaped insults on him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At noon, darkness came over the whole land until three in the afternoon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And at three in the afternoon Jesus cried out in a loud voice, “Eloi, Eloi, lema sabachthani?” (which means “My God, my God, why have you forsaken me?”).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When some of those standing near heard this, they said, “Listen, he’s calling Elijah.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Someone ran, filled a sponge with wine vinegar, put it on a staff, and offered it to Jesus to drink. “Now leave him alone. Let’s see if Elijah comes to take him down,” he said.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: With a loud cry, Jesus breathed his last.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The curtain of the temple was torn in two from top to bottom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the centurion, who stood there in front of Jesus, saw how he died, he said, “Surely this man was the Son of God!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some women were watching from a distance. Among them were Mary Magdalene, Mary the mother of James the younger and of Joseph, and Salome.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In Galilee these women had followed him and cared for his needs. Many other women who had come up with him to Jerusalem were also there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It was Preparation Day (that is, the day before the Sabbath). So as evening approached,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joseph of Arimathea, a prominent member of the Council, who was himself waiting for the kingdom of God, went boldly to Pilate and asked for Jesus’ body.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pilate was surprised to hear that he was already dead. Summoning the centurion, he asked him if Jesus had already died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he learned from the centurion that it was so, he gave the body to Joseph.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Joseph bought some linen cloth, took down the body, wrapped it in the linen, and placed it in a tomb cut out of rock. Then he rolled a stone against the entrance of the tomb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Mary Magdalene and Mary the mother of Joseph saw where he was laid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the Sabbath was over, Mary Magdalene, Mary the mother of James, and Salome bought spices so that they might go to anoint Jesus’ body.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Very early on the first day of the week, just after sunrise, they were on their way to the tomb
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they asked each other, “Who will roll the stone away from the entrance of the tomb?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when they looked up, they saw that the stone, which was very large, had been rolled away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As they entered the tomb, they saw a young man dressed in a white robe sitting on the right side, and they were alarmed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Don’t be alarmed,” he said. “You are looking for Jesus the Nazarene, who was crucified. He has risen! He is not here. See the place where they laid him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But go, tell his disciples and Peter, ‘He is going ahead of you into Galilee. There you will see him, just as he told you.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Trembling and bewildered, the women went out and fled from the tomb. They said nothing to anyone, because they were afraid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus rose early on the first day of the week, he appeared first to Mary Magdalene, out of whom he had driven seven demons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She went and told those who had been with him and who were mourning and weeping.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they heard that Jesus was alive and that she had seen him, they did not believe it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Afterward Jesus appeared in a different form to two of them while they were walking in the country.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These returned and reported it to the rest; but they did not believe them either.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Later Jesus appeared to the Eleven as they were eating; he rebuked them for their lack of faith and their stubborn refusal to believe those who had seen him after he had risen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Go into all the world and preach the gospel to all creation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever believes and is baptized will be saved, but whoever does not believe will be condemned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And these signs will accompany those who believe: In my name they will drive out demons; they will speak in new tongues;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: they will pick up snakes with their hands; and when they drink deadly poison, it will not hurt them at all; they will place their hands on sick people, and they will get well.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After the Lord Jesus had spoken to them, he was taken up into heaven and he sat at the right hand of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the disciples went out and preached everywhere, and the Lord worked with them and confirmed his word by the signs that accompanied it.
verses.speaker: Narrator
